No. 43 (Ep. CXCI) (Λα). 418)

TO SIXTUS‚‘² MY VENERABLE LORD AND HOLY BROTHER AND FELLow-PRIEST, WORTHY TO BE CHERISHED IN THE LOVE OF CHRIST, AUGUSTINE SENDS GREETING IN THE LORD

Since the letter your Grace sent by the hands of 1 our holy brother, the priest Firmus, reached Hippo during my absence, and on my return I had the chance to read it only after the bearer of it had taken his departure, this first opportunity of replying (and it is a very welcome one too) is afforded by our well- beloved son, the acolyte Albinus.⁶ Your letter, ad- dressed to Alypius and myself together, came at a time when we were not together, so in consequence you receive a letter from each of us, not one in the com- mon name of us both, for the bearer of this letter, hav- ing left me, will on his way pass by my revered brother and fellow-bishop, Alypius, so that he may write one for himself in reply to your Holiness 3 that letter of yours, after reading it, I sent on to him by the same bearer. As for the great joy with which your letter filled me, why should one attempt to utter feelings that defy utterance? Indeed, I am not sure that
